title: Vladimir Sorochinskiy
text:
Vladimir Sorochinskiy (; born 15 February 1980) is a retired <a href="Belarus">Belarus</a>ian professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a>er of <a href="Kazakhstan">Kazakh</a> origin. As of 2014 we works as an assistant coach for <a href="FC%20Gorodeya">Gorodeya</a>.
Career.
Born in <a href="Taraz">Jambyl</a>, <a href="Kazakh%20SSR">Kazakh SSR</a>, Sorochinskiy began playing football with hometown <a href="FC%20Taraz">FC Taraz</a>. In 1998, he signed with <a href="FC%20Dinamo%20Brest">FC Dinamo Brest</a> where he would make 62 <a href="Belarusian%20Premier%20League">Belarusian Premier League</a> appearances before moving to <a href="FC%20Slavia%20Mozyr">Slavia Mozyr</a> during the 2000 season.
Sorochinskiy would play for Slavia until he suffered a serious injury during the 2002 season. He returned to Dinamo Brest in 2004, playing for the club in the Premier League until 2005. Sorochinskiy has spent the remainder of his career in the lower divisions of Belarusian football, with <a href="FC%20Baranovichi">FC Baranovichi</a> and <a href="FC%20Gorodeya">FC Gorodeya</a>.
Honours.
Slavia Mozyr
